thread.title_full: Barnett Slepian, an abortion doctor, is killed in 1998 - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Barnett Slepian, an abortion doctor, is killed in 1998
text:
DON HEUPEL/AP Town of Amherst police officers station themselves in front of the house of Dr. Barnett Slepian on the morning of Saturday, Oct. 24, 1998, after he was shot and killed by a sniper's bullet. (Originally published by the Daily News on October 25, 1998. This story was written by Dave Goldiner.)
Police were hunting yesterday for a sniper who killed an upstate New York abortion doctor as he stood in his kitchen after returning from synagogue Friday night.
Dr. Barnett Slepian, 51, was shot once in the back. A killer armed with a high-powered rifle waited for the gynecologist to return home and shot him through a window.
The FBI, Canadian police and cops in helicopters mounted a huge search for the sniper yesterday in the upscale Buffalo suburb of Amherst.
"This is sad," neighbor Suby Shastry said. "Killing someone doesn't solve a problem."
Police said the slaying might be linked to the shootings of four other New York and Canadian doctors who perform abortions since 1993, all of which took place within a few weeks of Nov. 11, Veterans Day.
Slepian's name was ominously crossed out on a Web site with pictures of aborted fetuses and rantings against homosexuality and the government. The site has ties to the shadowy Army of God, which has claimed responsibility for the bombings of abortion clinics and a gay bar.
Slepian, who defied anti-abortion protesters who hounded him for years, and other doctors were warned just days ago to take safety precautions.
Slepian was shot Friday night minutes after he returned from Sabbath services with his wife and four sons, ages 7 to 15.
A decade ago, anti-abortion protestors taunted him with chants of "Murderer!" as his family opened Chanukah gifts inside.
New York Daily News The New York Daily News published this article on Oct. 25, 1998. JAMES P. MCCOY/AP Dr. Barnett Slepian was shot and killed in his kitchen after coming from his synagogue in 1998. Previous Next Enlarge But he steadfastly refused to be cowed. Neighbors said he remained down-to-earth man who was preparing to erect his elaborate annual Halloween display.
"He said, 'They're not going to scare me. They're not going to threaten me,'" recalled Harvey Rogers, a lawyer who represented Slepian after a confrontation with protestors.
Dr. Alexander Sanger, the president of Planned Parenthood of New York City, said anti-abortion fanatics were hoping to send a chilling message.
"It's a very frightening political statement that doctors shouldn't feel safe in the sanctity of their homes," Sanger said.
President Clinton said he was outraged by "this brutal and tragic act."
Gov. Pataki, who favors abortion rights, and Sen. Al D'Amato (R-N.Y.), who opposes them, both called for the death penalty for the sniper.
In 1993, another abortion doctor, David Gunn, was shot dead outside his Pensacola, Fla., clinic.
With News Wire Services.
